page.title: 11BY BUS TO SUTTON VILLAGE
page.content: {The small village of Sutton can be { reached from Woodbridge four times a { day by a bus service operated by { Bickers of Coddenham Ltd. There is no { Sunday or evening service however. The service, the B16, leaves the Turban Centre in Woodbridge and takes you through Melton across the railway at the newly installed automatic barrier gates. Melton Halt newly opened this year too, is the nearest station to the village. {Crossing the River Deben at the { Milford Bridge, the bus chugs up the { steep hill to the flat plateau of { Sutton Heath. Along the long straight road passing the Picnic Spot, the bus comes to its first stop after Melton Chapel at Sutton Post Office, after a twenty minute ride from Woodbridge. {
